0.title: Video of pre-wedding festivities of Supriya Pathak's daughter Sanah surfaces
0.article_body: A video from the pre-wedding festivities of actress Sanah Kapur, who will be marrying Mayank Pahwa, son of actor Manoj Pahwa, has surfaced. The video shows Sanah's mother and actress Supriya Pathak dancing with her sister and actress Ratna Pathak Shah. Pankaj Kapur had, on Monday, said, "I don't want to talk much, but yes it is my daughter's wedding."

1.title: US troops in Europe not to fight in Ukraine, but to defend allies: Biden
1.article_body: US President Joe Biden said American troops were deployed to Europe not to fight in Ukraine, "but to defend our NATO allies [if]...Russian President Vladimir Putin decides to keep moving west". The US has deployed troops to many NATO countries, including Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia. Earlier, Biden had said that Putin wants to "re-establish the former Soviet Union".

2.title: 1,080 kg of sea cucumber worth crores seized in Tamil Nadu
2.article_body: Based on a tip-off, Coastal Security Group of Tamil Nadu Police conducted a raid at an old building near Akkaraipettai on Tuesday and seized sea cucumbers worth crores in international market. They recovered 248 kg and 812 kg of preserved and unpreserved sea cucumbers respectively, along with 4 kg preserved sea horses and 15 kg shark wings during the raid.

3.title: Constable on poll duty killed, 11 others injured in Manipur accident
3.article_body: An India Reserve Battalion (IRB) constable was killed and 11 others were injured in an accident in Manipur's Tamenglong district. They were reportedly going for poll duty to Manipur from Mizoram. Five of the injured were flown to Imphal for treatment. According to police, the driver might have lost control of the vehicle as the road was narrow.

4.title: If World War 3 takes place, it will involve nuclear weapons: Russia
4.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that if World War 3 were to take place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive. Lavrov further said that Russia would face a "real danger" if Ukraine acquired nuclear weapons. This comes a week after Russia ordered military operation in Ukraine.

5.title: Liquor vendors move HC against Delhi govt's order stopping discount on alcohol
5.article_body: A group of private liquor license holders have approached the Delhi High Court challenging the Delhi government's February 28 order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol. The government said the decision was taken in view of overcrowding at liquor shops. "The rules of the game cannot be changed after the game has begun," the petitioners said.

6.title: UGC draft rules allow institutes to source 40% content externally for online degrees
6.article_body: Institutes offering online degrees can source up to 40% of their course content externally and develop the remaining 60% in-house, as per UGC draft guidelines. This will prevent students from putting extra effort in locating good online programmes to pursue, a senior UGC official said. "The institutes themselves will do the research and provide options to students," the official added.

7.title: He's shaping up well: Bumrah on Ashwin's fitness ahead of Mohali Test
7.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has provided an update on Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the Mohali Test against Sri Lanka, starting on March 4. "Ashwin is shaping up well...I'm not aware [if] there are any complaints...He was bowling, batting, fielding, he did everything," stated Bumrah. Ashwin was ruled out of the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

8.title: Russia to investigate 21-yr-old Indian student's death in Ukraine: Russian envoy
8.article_body: Russia will investigate the death of the 21-year-old Indian medical student in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Russian Ambassador-designate Denis Alipov said on Wednesday. Alipov offered his "deepest condolences" over the death of Naveen Gyanagoudar and conveyed his sympathy to the student's family in Karnataka. "Russia will do everything to ensure the safety of Indians in conflict zones," he added.

9.title: Russian soldiers punching holes in their vehicles, crying, firing at each other: Reports
9.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine are suffering from low morale and have deliberately punched holes in their vehicles' gas tanks, a Pentagon official said, reported New York Times. They are reportedly also suffering from food and fuel shortages. Voice recordings obtained by a British intelligence company reveal they were heard crying and sometimes even firing at each other, said reports.

10.title: Pathaan time starts now: SRK shares release date of his film 'Pathaan'
10.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce that his film 'Pathaan' will release on January 25, 2023 in theatres, adding, "I know it's late, but remember the date. Pathaan time starts now." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. 'Pathaan' marks Deepika's fourth film with Shah Rukh, having made her debut alongside him in 'Om Shanti Om'.

11.title: US sanctions on Russia won't affect us significantly: IAF Vice Chief
11.article_body: Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sandeep Singh on Wednesday said US sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine war "won't affect us significantly". "Things are still unfolding. Our position is very strong and our relations with both the countries have remained (strong)," Singh said. He added that India's "relations with Russia will continue" despite a difficult geopolitical situation.

12.title: Robberies, rapes rising in Ukraine as govt arms civilians amid war: Man in video
12.article_body: In a video filmed in Kyiv on February 28, a man claimed that criminals in Ukraine have got their hands on military-grade weapons after President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's regime declared that it would arm all civilians willing to fight against Russia. "There have been robberies, rapes and all kinds of havoc due to this," he said.

13.title: Child cancer patients sheltered in basement in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war
13.article_body: A video has emerged that shows child cancer patients sheltering in a basement in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, amid the Russian invasion. Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko shared the video on Twitter and wrote, "Little cancer patients in Kharkiv basement. These are unfit conditions for children who suffer enough as it is already!"

14.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Shreyas Iyer jumps 27 spots
14.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Shreyas Iyer jumping 27 spots to be ranked 18th. Meanwhile, KL Rahul dropped four spots to be ranked 10th. He is the only Indian in the top 10. Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka moved up six spots to be ranked ninth in the rankings led by Pakistan's Babar Azam.

15.title: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
15.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.

16.title: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
16.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.

17.title: Pending bills worth ₹800 cr for traffic violations in Hyd: T'gana Police
17.article_body: Telangana Police said that pending bills for traffic violations amount to ₹1,500 crore in the state as nearly five crore challans remain unpaid by citizens. Hyderabad accounts for ₹800 crore worth of pending bills for traffic violations, it added. Most of them pertain to the last two years, some of the challans date back to 2014, Hyderabad Police stated.

18.title: Hyd software employee posts fake ad to rent out area on Quikr; held
18.article_body: A software employee has been apprehended for allegedly giving fake advertisements on Quikr and taking advance payments from people in Hyderabad. Police have seized a car and an iPhone from him. The accused gave an advertisement on the online platform about an office with a 2,400-square feet area and quoted ₹35,000 as rent and ₹50,000 as advance for it.

19.title: Never cheated in my relationship, might've been cheated upon: Ananya
19.article_body: Speaking about infidelity, actress Ananya Panday said she has never cheated in a relationship. "Maybe I have been cheated upon but I'm not sure," she added. Ananya's 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi also said he's never cheated in a relationship. "It has to be...black or white for me. I cannot live in the grey area. It messes things up," he added.

20.title: Taiwan leaders to donate 1 month's salary for Ukraine relief measures
20.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Wednesday that she, Vice President William Lai and Premier Su Tseng-chang will each donate their one month's salary towards humanitarian efforts in war-torn Ukraine. President Tsai receives around $14,250 (₹10.7 lakh) per month as remuneration, Reuters reported. Additionally, the Taiwanese government has sent 27 tonnes of medical supplies to Ukraine.

21.title: Govt working day & night for you: Union Minister to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
21.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday welcomed Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "All of you have come with a sad memory to India. Many of you must not have been able to sleep for hours, days…Government working day and night for you," Shekhawat said while interacting with the evacuees.

22.title: Stop asking me questions on Russian invasion: Chelsea manager Tuchel
22.article_body: Reacting to a question by a journalist on the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said, "How often do I need to say it? It's horrible. You have to stop asking me these questions." "Everybody in Europe has some noise in their head that nobody likes," added Tuchel. "We have the right to focus on sports," he stated.

23.title: It is a crime to play a dot ball in T20s: Shreyas Iyer
23.article_body: Shreyas Iyer said it is a "crime" to play a dot ball in T20s adding that players need to work on intent. Shreyas was the highest run-scorer in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. He will lead KKR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹12.25 crore in the mega auction.

24.title: State Election Commission acting as slave to WB govt: BJP’s Anirban Ganguly
24.article_body: BJP leader Anirban Ganguly criticised WB CM Mamata Banerjee for the alleged violence during civic body polls and said the State Election Commission is acting as a "slave" to the WB government. "The Supreme Court and the Kolkata HC should introspect (the alleged violence) because when we filed a plea seeking deployment of Central security forces...It was dismissed," Ganguly added.

25.title: Mumbai Police summons Narayan Rane & son in Disha Salian case
25.article_body: The Mumbai Police has sent a notice to Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son Nitesh Rane, asking them to record statements this week in connection to the Disha Salian death case. An FIR was registered against the duo for allegedly spreading false information about Salian's death. Salian was the former manager of late Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput.

26.title: BBPV demands reduction of bus fares in Bengaluru in state Budget
26.article_body: Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has started a petition demanding reduction in bus fares and making travel free for women, transgenders and senior citizens. It asked the state government to allocate ₹1,000 crore to Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation in the upcoming state Budget to reduce the fare. BMTC fares, the highest in India, are strangling the working class, the petition read.

27.title: 21-yr-old Indian student's friends sent pic of his dead body from Ukraine: K'taka CM
27.article_body: After 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen was killed in shelling in Ukraine, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Naveen's friends have sent a photo of his body, sending it to MEA to confirm the same." Adding that Naveen's family will be compensated, CM Bommai said, "We're in touch with the Indian Embassy so that at least the body is secured."

28.title: Tamil Nadu govt releases examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12
28.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Department of School Education has released the examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12. The examination for class 10 will be held from May 6 to May 30 and the examination for class 12 will be held from May 5 to May 28. The examination for class 11 will be held from May 10 to May 31.

29.title: India able to evacuate citizens from Ukraine due to its rising power: PM
29.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said it's because of India's rising power that the government is able to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine. "Those who questioned valour of armed forces and 'Make in India' can't make country strong," he said at a rally in UP's Sonbhadra. He added that the government is making all efforts to evacuate citizens from Ukraine.

30.title: Sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 begins in Bay of Bengal
30.article_body: The sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 commenced in the Bay of Bengal on Tuesday. A total of 26 ships, 21 aircraft and one submarine are participating in the event which includes weapon firings and seamanship evolutions, among other exercises. The event aims at enhancing interoperability and maritime cooperation while sharing best practices among the participating navies.

31.title: Russia sees no desire from Ukraine to find legitimate solution: Envoy
31.article_body: Russian ambassador to UN Gennady Gatilov said Moscow sees "no desire on the part of Ukraine" to reach a legitimate and balanced solution to the problems between the countries. Russia "supports diplomacy based on respect for the positions of all countries and equality, but for now, we don't see that", he added. Russia and Ukraine held peace talks on Monday.

32.title: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacts with parents of students stuck in Ukraine
32.article_body: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacted with parents of students who are stranded in several parts of Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. He also updated the parents on the ongoing rescue operations under Operation Ganga. The meeting reportedly happened in Pune. Meanwhile, Union Ministers Smriti Irani, Gajendra Shekhawat and Rajeev Chandrasekhar welcomed Indians as they returned from Ukraine.

33.title: Honda suspends car, motorcycle exports to Russia amid invasion
33.article_body: Honda has suspended its automobile and motorcycle exports to Russia, amid growing sanctions on Russia in protest against its invasion of Ukraine. A Honda spokesperson said exports to Russia were already suspended as of Wednesday. The firm's suspension is reportedly based on complications with its distribution networks and concerns surrounding sanctions against Russia.

34.title: Robbers raid house posing as IT officials near B'luru; steal ₹35 lakh
34.article_body: Six men conducted a raid at a tomato trader's house near Bengaluru after posing as Income Tax officials and robbed him of ₹35 lakh cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers reportedly said they had orders to search the house and showed him files with CBI imprints. However, they later threatened the trader with knife after he got suspicious.

35.title: NDMC to provide scholarship to children of sanitation workers
35.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has decided to provide 'Palika Swachchta Scholarship' to help children of sanitation workers get admission to professional courses. "This scholarship will help...children in getting admission in medical, engineering and UPSC coaching or preparation," an official said. It will be implemented from the academic year 2022-2023, NDMC member Kuljeet Chahal said.

36.title: Pic of Indian girl carrying her pet dog from Ukraine amid war goes viral
36.article_body: A picture of Indian Medical student Arya Aldrin carrying her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war is going viral on social media. The duo reportedly crossed over to Romania. Kerala Minister V Sivankutty praised her online and wrote, "Without abandoning her pet dog, Arya is on her way to India from a war-torn country...the world benefits from such love."

37.title: 4 die while cleaning septic tank at Pune residential building
37.article_body: Four people died due to suffocation while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in Pune's Kadam Wak Wasti area on Wednesday, police said. The victims include those who were engaged in cleaning and those who look after the functioning of the residential colony. One of the deceased has been identified, the police said.

38.title: We were sleepless, listening to stories of pain: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir...'
38.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said she and director Vivek Agnihotri "were just listening to stories of the pain" before the 'The Kashmir Files' was rolled out. "Vivek and I used to reach back to hotel...gaze at ceiling...we were sleepless for hours...It was impossible to emotionally unwind...I told Vivek I was going back...I wasn't able to take more pain," Joshi said.

39.title: Ukraine to receive more missiles & Turkish drones: Defence Min
39.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Wednesday said the country was set to receive Stinger and Javelin missiles from abroad and another shipment of Turkish drones. Many Western countries have pledged to give or sell weapons to Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukraine said that more than 350 Ukrainians, including 14 children, have been killed in the conflict so far.

40.title: Can send 4 aircraft a day, each bringing 200 people from Ukraine: IAF
40.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Wednesday said that it can send four aircraft in a day to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine. "200 people will be brought back in one round," Vice Chief of Air Staff Sandeep Singh said. "Three IAF aircraft have been sent since morning to evacuate Indians. Relief materials are also being sent," he added.

41.title: Have readied SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency: Ukrainian engineer
41.article_body: A Ukrainian engineer, Oleg Kutkov, said he has readied his SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency use in case regular broadband services are cut amid war. "It's possible that...local internet infrastructure will be destroyed. This would be the emergency state," he said. Earlier, Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had shared an image of SpaceX Starlink terminals that arrived in Ukraine.

42.title: RPI(A) wants to contest 39 seats in PCMC elections: Ramdas Athawale
42.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) chief Ramdas Athawale said on Tuesday that his party is keen to contest 39 seats in the upcoming Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) polls. Athawale added that wherever RPI (A) has "strong candidates", party should be given tickets. "Our alliance [with BJP] will once again come to power in Pimpri-Chinchwad," he further said.

43.title: Godman gets 7-yr-jail for kidnapping & locking up Mumbai boy in 2015
43.article_body: A 57-year-old man, who had dressed as a Godman and kidnapped a 13-year-old boy from Mumbai in 2015, was sentenced to seven years imprisonment by a court in Dindoshi. The accused had taken the boy to Varanasi and kept him locked in a room for over four months. The victim was traced after a co-passenger on the train got suspicious.

44.title: Primary school kids arrested in Russia over anti-war signs, claims Opposition politician
44.article_body: Primary school children have been arrested at an anti-war protest in Russia, according to an Opposition politician. Ilya Yashin shared what appeared to be pictures of three children holding 'no to war' placard in the back of a police van. "Nothing out of the ordinary: just kids in paddy wagons behind an anti-war poster. This is Putin's Russia," he tweeted.

45.title: Olympian Stanislav takes up arms to fight Russia, says 'We'll kill every occupant'
45.article_body: Ukraine's Stanislav Mykolayovych Horuna, who bagged a bronze medal in karate at Tokyo Olympics, has taken up arms to fight Russia amid war with Ukraine."We will kill every occupant who invades," he wrote on Instagram. The 33-year-old also asked his followers on Instagram to donate to support the Ukrainian Army.

46.title: Oil price crosses $110 mark, reaches highest level since July 2014
46.article_body: Crude oil price hit its highest level since July 2014 as it rose past the $110/barrel mark on Wednesday as sanctions imposed on Russia continued to mount. Brent crude rose over 5.8% to $111.09/barrel, its highest since July 2014. US West Texas Intermediate jumped nearly 6% to $109.30/barrel, its highest since September 2013.

47.title: I just work and sleep, I last saw my family 3 days ago: Ukraine's President
47.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, when asked about his life amid the Russian invasion, in an interview said, "I work and sleep, that's it." When asked about whether he can see his family and kids, the Ukrainian President said, "No, I can't." He added that he last saw his family three days ago, in the middle of the war.

48.title: Ashneer's wife says 'time to move on', deletes tweets & videos against BharatPe
48.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain, who was recently fired by BharatPe, deleted tweets and videos criticising the activities of the company's top officials. "We stand by each of our statements but it's time for us to move ahead towards positivity and away from...endless media drama," she said. She also deleted an alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Bhavik Koladiya abusing Ashneer.

49.title: This is what 'Russian peace' looks like: Ukraine on video of missile in Kharkiv
49.article_body: The Defence of Ukraine's official Twitter account on Wednesday shared a video of a Russian missile striking the National Police building in Kharkiv. It also tweeted, "This is what 'Russian peace' looks like." This comes a day after a Russian strike on Kyiv's TV tower killed at least five people.

50.title: Only thing lavish is my dreams: Ashneer on BharatPe's 'fraud for lavish lifestyle' allegation
50.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday reacted to BharatPe's allegation of "fraud to fund a lavish lifestyle", by saying, "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams and ability to achieve them against all odds through hard work and enterprise." He added, "I'd want to learn who among Amarchand, PwC and A&M started doing an audit on 'lavishness' of one's lifestyle?"

51.title: Jason Roy takes indefinite break from cricket after pulling out of IPL 2022
51.article_body: England batter Jason Roy has announced he'll take an indefinite break from cricket to spend time with his family. This comes a day after Roy, who was bought by Gujarat Titans, pulled out of IPL 2022 citing bio bubble fatigue. "Everything going on in the world over the last three years...[has] taken its toll on me," he had said.

52.title: Int'l players should be able to dominate at domestic level: Saba Karim
52.article_body: Referring to the performance of Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said international level players should be able to dominate at the domestic level. "I'm not seeing it at the moment, and that is a concern," he added. Pujara and Rahane have scored 99 and 185 runs respectively in their two Ranji matches.

53.title: Mark my words, father-son duo will go to jail: Raut on BJP's Kirit, his son Neil
53.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP leader Kirit Somaiya and his son Neil will go to jail for misusing Central agencies. This comes after Mumbai court rejected the anticipatory bail plea of Neil Somaiya in connection with the PMC Bank case. "If no crime committed, why is the father-son duo moving court for anticipatory bail?" Raut questioned.

54.title: 'Today is not my birthday,' tweets Punjab CM after PM Modi, others wish him
54.article_body: Several leaders including PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend birthday wishes to Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi on Tuesday. Channi later tweeted a clarification, saying, "Grateful for all the wishes pouring in for me today, however today is not my birthday." PM Modi had wished him "good health and long life".

55.title: Congress, JD(S) leaders will join BJP ahead of 2023 polls: K'taka CM
55.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that several leaders from Congress and Janata Dal (Secular) are in touch with the BJP and will be joining the party in the days to come ahead of the 2023 polls. Congress will not come to power in Karnataka for 10 more years, state BJP President Nalinkumar Kateel said.

56.title: IFS officer shares video of stranded bear being released into the wild
56.article_body: An Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer, Parveen Kaswan, shared a video of a stranded Himalayan black bear being released into the wild on Twitter. In the video, the bear that appears to be a cub leaps out of the cage and runs towards the forest cover. "Rescue work was successful without any injury to people or animal," Kaswan tweeted.

57.title: Even when I was fat, I had work: Richa Chadha on body transformation
57.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha revealed that even before her physical transformation, she didn't find it difficult to find work. She said that even when she was fat, she had work. "And now that I'm thin, I want to tell actors, aspiring actors...that you don't have to be a certain shape to continue to get work in the film industry," she added.

58.title: Two kids injured as ceiling of a govt school building collapses in TN
58.article_body: A portion of a ceiling at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram collapsed injuring two kids aged eight and 10 on Tuesday. The district collector said six kids were playing inside the old school building whose demolition was under process when a wooden beam from the ceiling fell down. The two injured students were rushed to a government hospital.

59.title: Teams of teachers set up to visit homes of students back in Delhi from Ukraine
59.article_body: Two teams of teachers have been set up to be in touch with students who have returned to Delhi from Ukraine. Teams have been directed to visit homes of students who have returned from Ukraine after February 22 and "ensure all necessary steps are being taken for the welfare of students" and also visit families of students stuck in Ukraine.

60.title: Ukrainians line up at gun shops to buy rifles, shotguns amid Russian attack
60.article_body: Ukrainians are reportedly lining up at gun shops to buy rifles and shotguns amid attack by Russian forces. They are also getting trained in how to use the weapons inside the stores. Lviv police have simplified the procedure to buy weapons. The process which used to take two-three weeks can now be finished in two-three days, said a civilian.

61.title: Received India's request to evacuate Indians in Ukraine via Russian territory: Russia
61.article_body: Russian Ambassador-designate to India, Denis Alipov, has said, "We are in touch with the Indian authorities for Indians stranded in Kharkiv, and other areas of eastern Ukraine." "We have received India's request for emergency evacuation of all those stuck there via Russian territory," he further said. "India understands the depth of this crisis," he added.

62.title: BMC forms team to ensure early activation of centre for kids with special needs
62.article_body: The BMC has formed a task force for monitoring its recently announced facility to set up the first early intervention and rehabilitation centre for children with special needs. The task force will work towards early activation of the facility, an official said. The centre will provide medical facilities and therapies to children with any physical and mental disabilities.

63.title: Smriti Irani welcomes Indians evacuated from Ukraine in 4 regional languages
63.article_body: Union minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed Indians, who were evacuated from war-hit Ukraine under the Centre's Operation Ganga, in four different languages. In a video shared by her on Twitter, Irani was seen speaking in Malayalam, Bengali, Gujarati and Marathi aboard an IndiGo flight. She later said, "Welcome back home! We are grateful that our prayers have been heard."

64.title: I'm hoping he'll write a role for me: Upasana refutes rumours of rift with Kapil
64.article_body: Actress Upasana Singh refused rumours of a rift between her and comedian-actor Kapil Sharma. Upasana revealed she quit 'Comedy Nights With Kapil', which aired on Colors, because of commitment issues and not because she wasn't happy working with him. "Kapil and I...regularly communicate with each other. I'm hoping that he'll someday write a role for me," she added.

65.title: Fire breaks out at factory in Delhi's Narela, 4 fire engines rushed to spot
65.article_body: A fire broke out at a factory in north Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Wednesday, police said. Police received the information at about 11:03 am, following which four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. According to a senior police official, no person was reported to be inside the factory during the incident.

66.title: Russian forces destroy a maternity home in Ukrainian city, video surfaces
66.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of Russian forces destroying a maternity home in Zhytomyr. "If it is not a genocide, what is that?" the ministry wrote. Two people reportedly died at the maternity home in the attack. The Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

67.title: Man lures 4-year-old girl with candies, rapes her in UP; arrested
67.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped in Uttar Pradesh by a man who frequently visited her house. The man had come to the girl's house on Monday. He lured her to come to his place by offering her candies and then raped her. The girl was found semi-conscious with injuries on her private parts.

68.title: Russia planning to spread fake news about Ukrainian surrender: Ukraine
68.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Tuesday said that the country believes Russia is preparing a mass disinformation campaign to suggest senior military and political figures have surrendered. "To 'confirm' this fake information, seemingly signed 'documents', as well as fake, edited videos will be distributed," he further said in an online statement.

69.title: Google blocks Russia media firms RT, Sputnik on app store in Europe
69.article_body: Google has announced that it has blocked mobile apps related to Russian state-run media firms RT and Sputnik from its app store in Europe. RT Deputy Editor-in-Chief Anna Belkina said the outlet's distribution has been cut by technology companies without giving any evidence that it reported falsehoods. YouTube channels connected to RT and Sputnik were also blocked across Europe earlier.

70.title: Won't allow deplorable conduct of Grover family to tarnish our reputation: BharatPe
70.article_body: While removing Ashneer Grover as an employee, founder and director, BharatPe said in a statement, "The board will not allow the deplorable conduct of the Grover family to tarnish BharatPe's reputation." The company alleged that his family engaged in "misappropriation of funds" and Ashneer submitted his resignation ahead of the board's plan to table the report on the governance review.

71.title: Grover family used company's money to fund their lavish lifestyles: BharatPe
71.article_body: BharatPe on Wednesday alleged that Ashneer Grover and family "grossly abused" company expense accounts to "enrich themselves and fund their lavish lifestyles". The Grover family created "fake vendors through which they siphoned money away from the company's account", it said in a statement. BharatPe removed Ashneer as a founder, a day after he resigned as MD and director.

72.title: Russia claims taking full control of Ukraine's Kherson
72.article_body: The Russian Ministry of Defence has claimed that its troops have taken full control of southern Ukrainian city of Kherson. Russian military command is in talks with the Kherson municipality and other municipal departments, the ministry added. The Russia-Ukraine war entered its seventh day today. Heavy shelling was reported in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv as well.

73.title: 6,000 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine till Tuesday: V Muraleedharan
73.article_body: Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine and over 6,000 of them have been brought back till Tuesday, MoS MEA, V Muraleedharan, said on Wednesday. "Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine. Of these, 4,000 people returned by 24th February. Till yesterday, over 2,000 more people have returned," Muraleedharan added.

74.title: Anti-vaccine protesters clash with police outside New Zealand Parliament
74.article_body: A clash broke out between anti-COVID vaccine mandate protesters and the police outside the Parliament in New Zealand's Wellington on Wednesday. The agitators reportedly set several tents on fire creating thick clouds of smoke in the air. The police used pepper spray on some of the protesters and started towing vehicles blocking the streets in the area.

75.title: 2 men arrested after police bust sex racket in Pune
75.article_body: The Pune City Police have arrested a 20-year-old man and a 26-year-old man from Jharkhand for allegedly operating a sex racket. The accused, Jayshankar Sav and Kuldip Mahto, were allegedly trafficking women from other states to Pune for flesh trade. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly laid a trap at a hotel and arrested the alleged sex racketeers on Monday.

76.title: I used to plan my wicket celebrations, now I focus on making team win: Bumrah
76.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that when he was a youngster he used to get "overexcited" and "plan his celebrations" after taking wickets. "[Now], I try to focus on the job at hand...When the team has won...there's ample time to celebrate...my focus is on making the team win," he added. Bumrah has been named vice-captain for Sri Lanka Tests.

77.title: Appalled but not surprised: Ashneer Grover on BharatPe's allegations of fraud
77.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday said he is appalled by BharatPe's allegations of fraud and financial misdoing for a "lavish lifestyle" after the company said he's no longer an employee, founder or director. "I am appalled at the personal nature of the company's statement, but not surprised," said Ashneer. "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams," he added.

78.title: Not mandatory to seek resignation of any minister until crime proven: Jayant Patil
78.article_body: Maharashtra minister Jayant Patil said it's not mandatory to seek the resignation of any minister until the crime is proven. His statement comes as NCP's Nawab Malik has been arrested by the ED in connection with a money laundering case. "If everyday some kind of action is being taken against ministers, it isn't mandatory to seek their resignation," Patil added.

79.title: Australia’s wildfires caused a 1% loss in ozone, finds study
79.article_body: The 2019-2020 Australian bushfires resulted in depletion of the ozone layer, a study has found. As per the study, smoke that rose into the atmosphere due to these wildfires resulted in a 1% loss of ozone, an amount that usually takes 10 years to recover. Scientists have warned rising wildfires due to climate change may slow down ozone recovery further.

80.title: 2 men rape woman on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar
80.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two men on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar last week. The woman alleged that the accused said she was facing problems because of a black magic spell cast on her and claimed they would perform magic tricks to cure her sufferings. When she followed their instructions, they raped her.

81.title: HC to issue directions on pleas seeking removal of marital rape exception
81.article_body: Delhi High Court has said that it will issue directions on March 2 on the batch of pleas seeking criminalisation of marital rape and reserved its verdict in the case. The petitions filed challenged the exception to Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the criminal offence of rape.

82.title: I exploded on set, all actors became quiet: Bhansali on 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'
82.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he once "exploded" on the set of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' because he "wanted a certain atmosphere". "All the actors...became quiet. It was my way of giving those vibes to her [Alia]...Till date she doesn't know that this is what I did to get her into that space," he added.

83.title: Ukraine forces kill team of assassins who were plotting to murder President Zelenskyy
83.article_body: Head of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov announced on television that a unit of Chechen assassins sent on a mission to murder Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been "eliminated". "I can say that we received information from representatives of FSB (Russia's Federal Security Service) who have no desire to take part in this bloody war," Danilov added.

84.title: 2 men convicted for placing fence on railway tracks in Mumbai
84.article_body: A Mumbai court convicted two men in their thirties for placing a fence on railway tracks thus endangering lives. The accused had allegedly placed the fence between the Marine Lines and Charni Road railway stations in 2018. However, since they were arrested soon after the act, the court sentenced them to the period they had already undergone in custody.

85.title: 1 mn COVID vaccines expire in Guatemala as people refuse to take shot
85.article_body: Guatemala health authorities said over a million doses of Russia's Sputnik COVID-19 vaccine have expired because nobody was willing to take the shot. "We've tried to make available all the vaccines of different brands...Unfortunately, there has been a rejection among the public to vaccination," Health Minister Francisco Coma said, adding that the wasted shots cost the government about $11 million.

86.title: China conducts genocide, what more does Apple need to act: Meta ex-exec
86.article_body: Former Meta executive Alex Stamos in response to Apple's actions against Russia said, "The PRC [China] is conducting a genocide domestically; what more does Apple need to act?" "Apple has done more for...PRC than any other US tech company has done for any other authoritarian state," he added. Stamos said Apple prevents Chinese dissidents from installing secure messengers and VPNs.

87.title: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 Bihar districts contaminated: Economic Survey
87.article_body: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 out of 38 districts in Bihar is affected by arsenic, fluoride and iron contamination, state Economic Survey, 2021-2022, has revealed. "A total of 4,742 rural wards in 14 districts situated along the Ganga are...affected by arsenic contamination," the report added. The survey referred to the findings of the Public Health Engineering Department (PHED).

88.title: US First Lady Jill wears blue dress with sunflower in support of Ukraine
88.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden wore a blue dress featuring an embroidered sunflower on the sleeve as a tribute to Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. Blue is one of the colours of the Ukrainian flag, while the sunflower is the national flower of the country. Earlier, a video showing a Ukrainian woman giving sunflower seeds to Russian soldier went viral.

89.title: Putin's closest friend Abramovich is panicking, wants to sell Chelsea: Swiss billionaire
89.article_body: Calling Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich one of Vladimir Putin's closest advisers and friends, Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss said Abramovich is panicking like all other Russian oligarchs. "He's trying to sell all his properties in England. He also wants to get rid of Chelsea quickly," added Wyss. Wyss also said he has received an offer to buy the club from Abramovich.

90.title: Siblings on way to school hit by car with juvenile driver in Chandigarh
90.article_body: Two siblings, 17-year-old Jyoti and 15-year-old Suraj, were hit by a car being driven by a juvenile in Chandigarh's Mani Majra area on Tuesday. Jyoti suffered a fracture in one of her arms while Suraj received multiple injuries. The incident took place when the siblings were going to school. Police have started legal proceedings against the father of the driver.

91.title: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
91.article_body: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.

92.title: Husband had hernia surgery; he couldn't lift daughter for 2 months: Shriya
92.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran revealed her husband Andrei Koscheev had hernia surgery. Taking to Instagram, Shriya said that Andrei couldn't lift their daughter Radha for two months. Sharing a few pictures with her husband, Shriya wrote, "Thank you @theapollohospitals...for taking such good care of @andreikoscheev." Shriya also thanked actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela, for helping them.

93.title: Japanese defence veterans volunteer to fight for Ukraine: Report
93.article_body: As many as 70 Japanese, including 50 former members of the country's Self-Defense Forces, have reportedly volunteered to fight for Ukraine against the Russian invasion. Ukraine's Embassy in Japan thanked the Japanese people in a social media post but said, "Any candidates for this must have experience in Japan's Self-Defence Forces or have undergone specialised training."

94.title: Middlesbrough knock out Spurs, Man Utd in consecutive rounds of FA Cup
94.article_body: Middlesbrough FC defeated Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 in their fifth round encounter of the FA Cup following a goal in the second half of extra time by Josh Coburn, having earlier knocked out Manchester United. United crashed out of the FA Cup after a 7-8 defeat on penalties in the fourth round, with Cristiano Ronaldo missing a penalty in the match.

95.title: IPL is the strongest T20 league: Usman Khawaja on IPL vs PSL debate
95.article_body: Sharing his opinion on debate over the better T20 league between IPL and PSL, Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja said IPL is the strongest league in the world adding that there's not really a contest. "They have all the world come to them and it is the only league in the world to have Indian cricketers," stated Khawaja.

96.title: When things are not going for you, people start talking: Harmanpreet Kaur
96.article_body: India Women ODI vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who last scored an ODI ton in 2017, has said, "When things are not going for you, people start talking." Harmanpreet, however, also added her last two innings have given her a lot of confidence going into the Women's ODI World Cup. She scored a half-century and a century in her last two innings.

97.title: Delhi likely to receive light rainfall today and tomorrow: IMD
97.article_body: Delhi could expect light rainfall today and tomorrow due to western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department forecast showed. The maximum temperature in the national capital on Tuesday was at 26 degrees Celsius, which is likely to touch 28 degrees Celsius on Wednesday, the Met department said. Temperature in Delhi can go upto 30 degrees Celsius-mark by March 7, it added.

98.title: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
98.article_body: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.

99.title: Boeing suspends maintenance & technical support for Russian airlines
99.article_body: US planemaker Boeing said it's suspending "parts, maintenance and technical support for services for Russian airlines" as well as "major operations in Moscow". "As the [Ukraine-Russia] conflict continues, our teams are focused on ensuring the safety of our teammates in the region," a Boeing spokesperson said. Boeing on Monday had said it'd paused operations at its Moscow Training Campus.

100.title: Mumbai guard loses over a month's salary after wallet with ATM card stolen
100.article_body: A 62-year-old Mumbai-based security guard lost over ₹15,000, which is more than his month's salary, after his wallet along with ATM card was stolen while he was travelling on a local train, the police said. ATM PIN was written on the cover of the card, the complainant told police, adding that the thief withdrew the amount in three transactions.

101.title: Telangana records 152 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Hyderabad at 64
101.article_body: Telangana on Tuesday recorded 152 new COVID-19 cases, with Hyderabad reporting the highest number of cases at 64. Hyderabad was followed by the Mancherial district which reported 10 new cases. As many as 7,89,083 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Telangana so far. The state reported no COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday and the death toll so far remained at 4,111.

102.title: 'Jhund' breaks everything we have learnt in 20-30 years: Aamir Khan
102.article_body: Terming 'Jhund' as one of Amitabh Bachchan's "greatest films", Aamir Khan said, "I don't have words because it is a very surprising film. It breaks everything we've learnt in 20-30 years being in Bollywood." "I got up with a spirit and this film won't leave me," added Aamir. "It's very unique. I don't know how it got made," he stated.

103.title: It's my daughter's wedding: Pankaj Kapur confirms Sanah's wedding with Mayank
103.article_body: Actor Pankaj Kapur confirmed that his daughter Sanah Kapur is getting married. Sanah will tie the knot with actor Manoj Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar on Wednesday. Speaking to a portal, Pankaj said, "I don't want to talk much about this, but yes it's my daughter’s wedding." Actor Vivaan Shah also shared a video from her pre-wedding celebrations.

104.title: 2 men open fire at wedding in Punjab, threaten lawyer with videos; booked
104.article_body: Punjab police booked two men for allegedly opening fire in air during a wedding function in Kakka village in November 2021. According to complaint registered against them, the accused filmed the act and threatened a lawyer who had a property dispute with them by sending him the video on phone. The duo was reportedly inebriated when the incident happened.

105.title: He'll never come back, please save those who are alive: Brother of Indian killed in Ukraine
105.article_body: The elder brother of Naveen SG, the fourth-year medical student from Karnataka who was killed in the war in Ukraine, has said, "My brother will never come back but please save those who are alive." "Many parents are spending every minute anxiously," he added. Naveen's father also urged the government to bring back stranded students in Ukraine.

106.title: David Warner performs hook step of 'Bachchhan Paandey' song, Akshay Kumar reacts
106.article_body: Australia batter David Warner took to Instagram to share a video of himself performing hook step of 'Maar Khayegaa' song from Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey'. "How did I go @akshaykumar?" he wrote. "You've hit it out of the park brother," Akshay Kumar responded. "Friendship broken with Tollywood, now Bollywood is my best friend!" a fan jokingly commented on Warner's video.

107.title: 57 kg ganja seized from passengers on board trains entering Bengaluru
107.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) in Bengaluru seized 57 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh from passengers on board the Howrah Express and Kakinada Express between February 24 and February 26. "The harvest season has begun for ganja grown in Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and hence we're seeing...surge in smuggling activity," GRP Superintendent, Karnataka, Siri Gowri, told The New Indian Express.

108.title: Hollywood actor Sean Penn escapes Ukraine on foot; shares pic
108.article_body: Hollywood actor Sean Penn shared a picture as he escaped Ukraine on foot. "Myself & two colleagues walked miles to the Polish border after abandoning our car," he wrote. "Almost all the cars in this photo carry women & children only, most without any sign of luggage, and a car their only possession of value," he added.

109.title: Kerala HC upholds ban on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV
109.article_body: A division bench of Kerala High Court on Wednesday upheld the order on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV's ban. HC dismissed the appeal filed by Madhyamam Broadcasting Limited, the channel's parent company, against the Union I&B Ministry's order to revoke the channel's licence. Centre had banned the telecast of MediaOne TV, which is backed by Jamaat-e-Islami, citing security reasons.

110.title: Ukraine President's wife shares pics of women amid war, pays tribute to them
110.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's wife Olena Zelenska took to Instagram to share pictures of Ukrainian women amid war. "Our current resistance has a particularly female face. My admiration and bow to you, incredible compatriots," she wrote. "Everything will be spring, everything will be victory, everything will be Ukraine!" she further wrote.

111.title: Music teacher didn’t think I was good, put me out of choir class: Usha
111.article_body: Singer Usha Uthup said her music teacher did not think she was "very good for music" and put her "out of choir class". "Years later...when I was performing...in Delhi, my music teacher was in audience. I dedicated a song...we had both cried," she said, adding, "It's not that I'm a good singer or a bad singer; I'm 100% original singer!"

112.title: Operation Ganga just a big photo op, lakhs evacuated during Gulf war: CPI(M)
112.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury called Operation Ganga, which aims to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine, a big photo op. "A big photo op session is going on for the last three days," he said. "India evacuated more than a lakh people during the Gulf War, over a lakh during the Libyan crisis but there were no photographs," he added.

113.title: Nike temporarily halts sales in Russia via its website, app
113.article_body: Nike is temporarily halting sales from its website and app in Russia, saying that it "cannot guarantee delivery of goods to customers in Russia". An update on its website directed customers to their nearest Nike stores. Ukrainian Member of Parliament Lesia Vasylenko praised Nike saying it's a "great example" of how private companies can impose sanctions against Russia.

114.title: Biden calls Ukrainians 'Iranians' during speech; video goes viral
114.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Ukrainians "Iranians" during his State of the Union speech on Tuesday, with the video going viral on social media. "Putin may circle Kyiv with tanks, but he'll never gain the hearts and souls of the Iranian people," Biden said. "Did I hear that incorrectly?" a social media user said.

115.title: Firm behind Free Fire app loses $132 bn in market value in 5 months
115.article_body: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost $132 billion in market value from its peak last year in October. Its shares fell 13% in US trading on Tuesday, wiping $11 billion from its market valuation. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.

116.title: Apollo 24|7 launches One Tap consultations starting at just ₹250
116.article_body: Apollo announced one-tap consultation with their expert doctors using Apollo 24|7, along with round-the-clock consultation available even for minor illnesses at just ₹250. Users will benefit from Apollo 24|7 and no-one will have to take medicines without proper medical supervision, Apollo said, calling it a big step towards better healthcare in India. Users can download Apollo 24|7 app for free.

117.title: It won't be easy for Warner, Shaheen Afridi is good with new ball: Butt
117.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Salman Butt has said it won't be easy for Australia opener David Warner to open innings in Pakistan. "Shaheen Afridi is a good bowler...Warner survives in Australia because the ball doesn't seam that much. In Pakistan, the ball moves in the first session," he added. The first Test between Pakistan and Australia will begin on March 4.

118.title: WB CM Mamata Banerjee 'not abiding by the Constitution': Guv Dhankhar
118.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that CM Mamata Banerjee is "not abiding by the Constitution". "Under Article 167, the Governor has every right to question the state government...Mamata Banerjee for the last two years is not answering any queries of the Governor," he added. "It seems...Governor is the puppet of BJP," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.

119.title: I lost my on-screen virginity after kissing Kirti in 'Human': Shefali
119.article_body: Talking about her kiss with Kirti Kulhari in show 'Human', Shefali Shah said she lost her "on-screen virginity" as she had never kissed on-screen before. "I don't see it as being difficult because it's a woman. It was a true emotion," added Shefali. "I am terrified when I go on sets. I have a lot of self doubt," stated Shefali.

120.title: You've shown exemplary courage: Smriti Irani to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
120.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed the Indian students evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "Welcome back home, your families are waiting with bated breath. You've shown exemplary courage," Irani said while interacting with the students as the flight landed at the Delhi airport. "Let's thank the flight crew as well," Irani added.

121.title: Govt was late in ordering evacuation of Indians from Ukraine: Chidambaram
121.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said that the Centre was late in ordering the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "The government was late in ordering evacuation. The government was also guilty of encouraging Indians to believe that nothing untoward was likely to happen in Ukraine," Chidambaram tweeted yesterday.

122.title: No migratory bird census at Harike wetland for first time in 11 years
122.article_body: For the first time in 11 years, the annual census of migratory birds descending upon Punjab's Harike wetland was not conducted due to COVID-19 pandemic. Migratory birds arrive at Harike wetland in the first week of November and stay till March. "As per the latest survey, around 80 species of migratory birds visited the wetland this year," an official said.

123.title: Ukraine's ambassador to US gets standing ovation at Biden's State of the Union
123.article_body: Ukrainian envoy Oksana Markarova received a standing ovation during President Joe Biden's first State of the Union address. "The Ukrainian Ambassador to the US is here...Let's...stand and send an unmistakable signal to the world, to Ukraine," Biden said. "She's bright, she's strong, she's resolved," he said about Markarova, who held a Ukrainian flag and placed her hand over her heart.

124.title: Was told blood went to heart during CPR due to work out: Bob Odenkirk
124.article_body: While talking about heart attack that he suffered last year in July, American actor Bob Odenkirk said that he was told that more blood was able to go to his heart during CPR because his veins were bigger due to his working out. "Because I was in good shape...you...enlarge veins around your heart...if you work out a lot," he said.

125.title: I had never stepped inside a gym before playing Black Widow: Scarlett
125.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson said she had "never" stepped inside a gym before being asked to portray the character of Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow in 2010 movie 'Iron Man 2'. "I had five weeks to prepare myself for these huge stunt sequences," added Scarlett. 'Iron Man 2' also starred Robert Downey Jr and Samuel L. Jackson.

126.title: More heat waves likely in northwest India during summer: IMD
126.article_body: The probability of heat waves over west-central and northwest India will be higher during summer, IMD Director General, Mrutyunjay Mohapatra, said. Normal or below normal heat conditions and lesser heat waves are likely during the upcoming summer season over large geographical areas covering the southern peninsula, central India, the northern plains, east and northeast India, IMD said.

127.title: I'd think to myself 'I'm going to die': Reynolds on battling anxiety
127.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds, who plays the lead role in the 'Deadpool' franchise, said, "I have had anxiety my whole life. I would be standing backstage...and I would think to myself 'I'm going to die'. Something horrible's going to happen." "The home that I grew in, that wasn't modelled for me really," added Reynolds who also starred in 'X-Men Origins: Wolverine'.

128.title: PWD to redevelop footpath near IP Flyover to make it pedestrian-friendly
128.article_body: In order to ensure pedestrian safety, the Public Works Department (PWD) is planning to redevelop the footpath from Indraprastha (IP) flyover to ITPO integrated tunnel works. "Currently, the footpath is not in...good condition. It is broken, uneven and two-wheelers often use it to escape traffic jams," an official said. The redevelopment project is estimated to cost ₹79.39 lakh.

129.title: US oil giant Exxon to exit its last Russian project, won't make new investments
129.article_body: American oil giant ExxonMobil will exit its last remaining oil and gas project in Russia and won't invest in new developments in Russia, following Ukraine's invasion. Exxon operates the Sakhalin-1 project on behalf of a consortium that includes Japanese, Indian and Russian companies. Exxon would end over a quarter-century of continuing business presence in Russia by quitting this project.

130.title: Won’t impose sanctions on Russia, want good relations with all: Mexico
130.article_body: The Mexican government said it will not impose any sanctions against Russia over its conflict with Ukraine as it wants to have good relations with all governments. "We want to be in a position to be able to speak with all parties to the conflict," said President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador. He further accused Twitter of censoring messages supporting Russia.

131.title: Novak Djokovic splits with coach Marian Vajda after 15 years
131.article_body: Novak Djokovic has parted ways with his coach Marian Vajda, who has been with the ex-world number one for the last 15 years and saw him win 20 Grand Slam titles. "Marian has been by my side during the most important and memorable moments in my career...While he might be leaving the professional team he'll always be family," said Djokovic.

132.title: Gangster who had been hiding in Thailand held on landing at Delhi airport
132.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a wanted gangster Virender Partap alias Kala Rana, who had been hiding in Thailand, after he landed at Delhi airport. He was running a syndicate in India from Thailand, police said. "Rana was carrying a reward of ₹1,00,000 for his arrest in connection with a case registered in Haryana," police added.

133.title: Mizoram sets up genome sequencing facility in govt hospital
133.article_body: A genome sequencing facility has been set up at the state-run Virus Research and Diagnostic Laboratory (VRDL) of Zoram Medical College in Mizoram. The laboratory is funded by a US-based organisation called Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH), Health Minister Dr R Lalthangliana informed. Earlier the state's COVID-19 samples were sent to West Bengal's Kalyani for genome sequencing.

134.title: Russia kills our kids, now kill their App Store access: Ukraine Vice PM to Apple CEO
134.article_body: After Apple announced that it paused all its product sales in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote on Twitter, "(CEO) Tim Cook, let's finish the job and block App Store access in Russia." "They kill our children, now kill their access!" he said. Last week, Fedorov had written to Cook, asking Apple to cut services supply in Russia.

135.title: Despite 97%, he couldn't get a medical seat in India: Father of Indian killed in Ukraine
135.article_body: After 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar was killed in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war with Russia, his father Shekharappa said despite scoring 97% in Class 12, his son couldn't get a medical seat in India. "It became inevitable for us to send him to Ukraine...but we lost him," he added. Naveen was a fourth-year MBBS student at Kharkiv National Medical University.

136.title: Many B'wood actors were 'allergic' to act in south remakes: Tusshar
136.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor said earlier many actors in Bollywood had this "allergy" that they'll not do a South remake and will not work with a South director either. He added, "But now, most of these actors are open to doing remake films." Tusshar said he liked his father Jeetendra's remake films. "I'm not biased...I liked them all," he added.

137.title: Pakistani, Turkish students using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine: Indian students
137.article_body: Indian students who arrived in Romania from Ukraine said, "Pakistani and Turkish students are using Indian Flag to escape Ukraine amid the war." "Both Indian Flag and Indians were of great help to the Pakistani and Turkish students," they added. Earlier today, around 220 Indian students arrived in Delhi on a special flight via Istanbul.

138.title: I cut curtain, used spray colours to make Indian Flag: Indian student on escaping Ukraine
138.article_body: An Indian student who reached Bucharest in Romania after escaping Ukraine said, "I cut a curtain and used spray colours to make Indian Flag to paste on the bus." "We were easily given clearance due to Indian Flag," another student said. "Print out Indian Flag and paste prominently on vehicles and buses while travelling," Indian Embassy in Kyiv had said.

139.title: Never imagined I'll be alive: Indian student who left Ukraine's Kharkiv
139.article_body: An Indian student, Rupam Mondal, who managed to leave Ukraine's Kharkiv with friends by train said that there was continuous hurling of bombs and that they could not get out of bunker. "We were preparing food in hostel building when suddenly bombing started. It felt like earthquake. I never imagined I will be alive, it was really scary," Mondal said.

140.title: Husband demands fresh probe over wife's death in Maharashtra jail
140.article_body: Seeking a fresh probe over the death of Kanchan Nanavare in Maharashtra's Yerwada women's prison last year, her husband moved Bombay HC alleging negligence by jail authorities and lack of proper medical care. Kanchan was booked by the Maharashtra ATS in connection with a Maoist case in September 2014 and she died in jail on January 24, 2021.

141.title: Russia plans to introduce Belarusian troops into the war: Ukraine
141.article_body: Russia is preparing a "provocation" to justify the entry of Belarusian troops into the war, the Ukrainian Defence Ministry's Intelligence Unit said. "There are now about 300 Belarusian tanks near the Belarusian-Ukrainian border," it added. Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Tuesday said he's deploying more forces to the Ukraine border but denied having plans to join Russia's invasion.

142.title: Will PM Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off: BJP's Swamy
142.article_body: Talking about the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy asked PM Narendra Modi to direct Russia to stop its military offensive. Taking to Twitter, Swamy said, "Now that it is clear that what Russia has done in Ukraine violates BRICS Resolution in Delhi Declaration of last year. Will Modi have the guts to tell Putin to back off?"

143.title: Ukraine-Russia talks unlikely on Wed, Russian demands unrealistic: Turkey
143.article_body: Turkey on Tuesday said Ukrainian and Russian delegations were unlikely to meet for planned talks on Wednesday, adding Moscow's demands to end the invasion were "unrealistic". The talks will "most likely be postponed a couple of days, we're in touch with the negotiating teams", Turkish Presidential Spokesman Ibrahim Kalin said. The first round of negotiations had taken place on Monday.

144.title: When someone says, 'Your time is done', it's hard: Karthik on Wriddhiman
144.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a quiet servant of Indian cricket but now he needs to understand "where the selectors, the coach are coming from" in suggesting him to consider retirement. Karthik also added, "When somebody comes in and says, 'I think your time is done,' it can be a hard one to swallow."

145.title: Ankita Lokhande, Vicky Jain buy Mercedes worth ₹1.10 crore, pics surface
145.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande and her husband, businessman Vicky Jain, recently bought a Mercedes-Benz V220d. Taking to Instagram, photographer Viral Bhayani shared a video of the luxury car that arrived at Ankita and Vicky's house. In the video, Ankita along with her husband can be seen removing the cover from the car and is also seen cutting the cake to celebrate.

146.title: Russia’s demands must be addressed, sanctions illegal: China
146.article_body: China on Tuesday said that Russia's "legitimate security demands" owing to NATO's eastward expansion must be taken seriously and properly addressed. It also opposed the sanctions imposed on Moscow by various countries over its ongoing conflict with Ukraine. "We oppose all illegal unilateral sanctions. China and Russia will continue to carry out normal trade cooperation," said Chinese government.

147.title: Don't want to be most beautiful woman, but I'm not hot how I look: Shefali
147.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she has lot of self-doubts. "It's not like that I want to be most beautiful woman in the world but I am not hot the way I look," she said, adding, "I'm terrified when I go on sets...I have this...fear director is gonna say action and I'm...gonna stand there dumbfounded not knowing what to do."

148.title: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January: Report
148.article_body: WhatsApp banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January based on complaints received from users and its own mechanism, according to its report. Meta-owned WhatsApp received grievances against 495 Indian accounts which appealed to ban 285 accounts, out of which 24 were banned. The majority of the accounts were banned for harmful behaviour detected through tools and resources deployed by WhatsApp.

149.title: Mumbai fire dept plans to get 6 fire engines equipped for congested areas
149.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade Department is planning to get six new water tower vehicles that can reach a height of up to 18 metres. These vehicles will be beneficial in tackling fire incidences in densely populated areas and old chawls. Following the approval of the plan, the vehicles are expected to be delivered within 2-4 months.

150.title: 23-yr-old killed over affair with married woman by her brothers in Noida
150.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly killed over suspicion of having an affair with a married woman by her brothers in Greater Noida, police said. "The brothers revealed...they saw the man at their home with their sister...brawl broke out...brothers said they strangled him to death," police added. Preliminary investigation showed the victim's body was thrown into the Ganga canal, police added.

151.title: Russian airborne troops land in Ukraine's Kharkiv, attack hospital
151.article_body: The Ukrainian army has said that Russian airborne troops have landed in the eastern city of Kharkiv. "Russian troops attacked a local hospital. There is an ongoing fight," the army added. At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured when Russian forces bombarded the central square in Kharkiv on Tuesday.

152.title: Indian man turns his basement restaurant in Kyiv into shelter home, provides free meals
152.article_body: Manish Dave, a 52-year-old man from Gujarat, has turned his basement restaurant named 'Saathiya' in Kyiv into a shelter home. Since the war broke out on Thursday, Dave has housed and fed more than 130 people at his restaurant. "I will continue to offer shelter and food [for free] for as long as I can," Dave told The Washington Post.

153.title: Two govt officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees: Karnataka CM
153.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said efforts are on to bring back Kannadigas from Ukraine. "Two (government) officials have been deployed at Mumbai and New Delhi to help the state's people arriving from Ukraine reach their homes without any hassle," Bommai added. "The students in the north-eastern part of Ukraine are facing problems," Bommai told reporters.

154.title: Delhi govt invites expression of interest for 'Dilli Bazaar' portal
154.article_body: The Delhi government has invited expression of interest from agencies to design, develop, operate and maintain the 'Dilli Bazaar' e-commerce platform, including the online portal and offline services. The platform will help local businesses by providing them access to a global online community, Dialogue and Development Commission of Delhi Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said.

155.title: I'm not iconic, Ukraine is iconic: Zelenskyy on becoming a wartime leader
155.article_body: During a CNN interview, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was asked about his journey from a comic actor to a global wartime leader, to which he responded, "It's very serious, it's not a movie." "I'm not iconic, I think Ukraine is iconic," Zelenskyy said. "Ukraine is the heart of Europe...[the] world can't lose this something special," he added.

156.title: Apple halts all product sales in Russia, days after Ukraine Vice PM's request
156.article_body: Apple has paused sale of its iPhone and other products in Russia, days after Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov wrote to Apple CEO Tim Cook. Apple said state-controlled news outlets RT and Sputnik are no longer available on the App Store outside Russia. It has also stopped live traffic updates on Apple Maps in Ukraine as a safety measure.

157.title: Newborn girl's body with umbilical cord found in garbage dump in Gurugram
157.article_body: A newborn girl's body was found in garbage dump in Gurugram's Sector 52. Incident came to light when a passerby spotted body and alerted security guard. Security guard said body was wrapped in "blood-soaked cloth". Police said an umbilical cord was still attached to body. "It will become clear if the infant was stillborn after the autopsy," an officer said.

158.title: Some people say Putin has cancer, others say he has brain fog from COVID: Pelosi
158.article_body: During an interview, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said, "I've talked to heads of state who have met with Russian President Vladimir Putin...Some say he has cancer and some people say brain fog from COVID-19. Other people just think he's a complete raging bully." Pelosi said this after she was asked if "something's wrong with Vladimir Putin".

159.title: 2 realtors shot dead in Telangana; police suspect business rivalry
159.article_body: Two realtors were shot dead in Telangana's Ranga Reddy district on Tuesday. The locals found a Mahindra Scorpio SUV from which blood was oozing out and alerted the police. One of the victims had died on the spot while the other succumbed to injuries during treatment. The police said it appeared to be a dispute arising out of business rivalry.

160.title: India reports 7,554 new COVID-19 cases; over 600 higher than yesterday
160.article_body: India has reported 7,554 new COVID-19 cases and 223 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,915 cases and 180 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 85,680, while the death toll in the country reached 5,14,246. Over 4.2 crore people have recovered so far.

161.title: Naxal killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada
161.article_body: A Naxal carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with the security personnel in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Tuesday, a senior official said. The encounter took place between the DRG and Naxals in the forest near Tumkapal village. Following the encounter, police recovered a pistol, 5 kg IED, books and other materials.

162.title: Form special teams to identify govt teachers taking private tuitions: HC to TN govt
162.article_body: Madras HC's Madurai Bench directed Tamil Nadu government to form special teams to identify government teachers taking private tuitions or running private businesses. HC was hearing a government teacher's plea against dismissal of her request for transfer to another district. Common numbers must be provided for parents and students to file complaints regarding misconducts by teachers, HC directed.

163.title: I get to live beautiful things with you: Hailey on Justin's on 28th b'day
163.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber wished her husband, singer Justin Bieber, on his 28th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Hailey shared a few pictures with her husband and wrote, "Happy birthday my baby...there are a lot of amazing and beautiful things about this life, but the most beautiful part is that I get to live it with you. I love you...here's to 28."

164.title: Airbnb CEO says US sanctions affecting firm's Russian operations
164.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said US sanctions on Russian banks have affected its ability to operate within the country. He added that a lot of their business will probably be halted "from the inability to be able to pay". Chesky also said that "all things are on the table right now" with regard to voluntarily limiting Airbnb's Russian operations.

165.title: 4 arrested for selling spurious ghee in Patanjali packs in Chandigarh
165.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested three shopkeepers and a supplier for allegedly selling spurious ghee under packaging of popular brand Patanjali. Police raided the shops after the director of a company authorised by Patanjali to take action against shops selling spurious ghee under their name filed a complaint. The ghee was found to be made with a chemical unfit for human consumption.

166.title: Man sleeping on pavement killed after being run over by a tempo in Pune
166.article_body: A man sleeping on a pavement in Pune's Katraj was killed on Monday morning after the driver of a tempo ran the vehicle over him while on reverse. The police had arrested the accused, Sadashiv Chate, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. However, the driver was released on bail the same day by a local court, police said.

167.title: Naseem Shah added to Pakistan squad for 1st Test against Australia
167.article_body: Pakistan's 19-year-old pacer Naseem Shah, who was originally named as a reserve, has been included in the squad for their first Test against Australia after Haris Rauf was ruled out as he returned positive for COVID-19. Earlier, Faheem Ashraf and Hasan Ali were ruled out due to injuries, with Iftikhar Ahmed and Mohammad Wasim Jr being added to the squad.

168.title: Man stabbed to death after fight between 2 groups at Delhi gym
168.article_body: A man was allegedly stabbed to death at a gym in Delhi's Paharganj after a fight broke out between two groups. "There was an incident of a fight inside a gym between two boys, who also called their families," police said giving details. "The fight got aggravated and one party attacked the other with a knife killing one," they added.

169.title: Online forum, man booked over posts against HC judge in Bengaluru
169.article_body: The Bengaluru Police registered a case against an online forum Mangalore Muslims and Ateeq Shariff for allegedly posting against a High Court judge who is hearing the hijab case. The Facebook posts were derogatory and cast aspersions on the independence of the judge, the police said. Earlier, Kannada actor Chetan Kumar Ahimsa was arrested for posting against the same judge.

170.title: 80-year-old man lights his own pyre, dies in Nagpur
170.article_body: An 80-year-old man reportedly killed himself by lighting his own pyre in Nagpur. According to family of the deceased, identified as Atmaram Motiram Thawkar, he had a trachea surgery in 2006 from which he never fully recovered. Based on initial probe, police said Thawkar performed puja at a village temple and then built a pyre in a field using firewood.

171.title: Police scale wall to rescue woman, kids locked by her husband in Gujarat
171.article_body: Gujarat Police scaled walls of house to rescue woman and her children who had been locked by woman's husband. The husband reportedly locked them up after woman insisted on attending the last rites of her grandfather. Reports said husband also threatened to attack them with sharp objects. Woman asked for help from balcony. Police then reached woman's room through balcony.

172.title: I lost 7-kg weight during South Africa tour due to infection: Shreyas Iyer
172.article_body: Batter Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he lost 7-kg weight during India's tour of South Africa in December-January. "I had a very bad stomach infection at the start of the year when we were in South Africa.  Basically, whatever I was eating, it was coming out. It was one of the worst phases of my life," Iyer said.

173.title: Ex-BJP MP alleges 4 people known to him kidnapped from outside Delhi home
173.article_body: Senior BJP leader AP Jithender Reddy alleged four of his acquaintances, including a personal driver, were abducted from outside his Delhi residence on Monday. Reddy, a former MP from Mahbubnagar, was in Hyderabad at the time of the alleged incident. In a video shared by Reddy, five-seven men can purportedly be seen forcing the men to get inside a car.

174.title: We will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, luxury apartments, private jets: Biden
174.article_body: During the State of the Union speech on Tuesday, US President Joe Biden said that the US along with European allies will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, their luxury apartments and their private jets.
