He added that people are facing difficulty as no airport or airstrip is left in Ukraine. "Still, we're talking to Ukrainian govt, neighbouring countries' govts to bring our citizens back," Singh added.

349.title: The label of a TV actor hurts actors working in TV shows: Urvashi
349.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said the categorisation of actors working in TV shows as TV actors hurts them, adding that it is an "awful" discrimination. "Most people taking the call of casting actors for OTT are from the TV background, but are hesitant to cast actors from TV saying we are too exposed," stated Urvashi.

350.title: 22-year-old killed by 3 friends after fight over PUBG game in Thane
350.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Tuesday arrested a 19-year-old and detained two minors for killing their 22-year-old friend after a "fight over...PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) game", police said. The deceased, Sayeel Jadhav, was killed on Monday in Thane's Vartak Nagar after being stabbed with a sharp weapon. They used to drink (liquor), play online games and get into constant fights, locals claimed.

351.title: Shibani drops 'Mrs Akhtar' from bio days after wedding with Farhan
351.article_body: Actress-model Shibani Dandekar on Tuesday removed 'Mrs Akhtar' from her social media bio days after getting married to actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar. She had added 'Mrs Akhtar' to her bio on February 23. The couple got married on February 19 in a private ceremony at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's farmhouse in Khandala. Shibani has updated her username to Shibani Dandekar-Akhtar.

352.title: My heart really goes out to Ukraine: Lady Gaga at SAG Awards 2022
352.article_body: Singer-actor Lady Gaga spoke about the Russia-Ukraine conflict at SAG Awards 2022, saying, "My heart really goes out to Ukraine. I think tonight we should all sit in the gratitude of this." She also posted a picture on Instagram, writing, "I'm praying tonight for Ukraine and am sending smiles to all your hearts I pray will be whole soon."

353.title: Pune ZP organises meetings to promote property ownership among women
353.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has organised special gram sabha to mark International Women's Day this year and encourage property ownership among women. Gram panchayats in Pune district have been setting up camps to include women's names on property cards. "Property ownership is an important aspect of empowerment, [we're] working hard to facilitate [it]," Ayush Prasad, CEO of Pune ZP said.

354.title: Suspect wanted for Pak journalist's murder killed in police encounter
354.article_body: The prime suspect in the murder of Pakistani journalist Athar Mateen was killed in a police encounter in Qambar Shahdadkot on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the police conducted a raid based on a tip-off. The suspect reportedly opened fire at the police party and was subsequently killed in retaliation. Notably, two other suspects have been arrested.

355.title: Indians waive tricolour, chant Vande Mataram on return from Ukraine
355.article_body: Another batch of Indian nationals that returned from Ukraine on Tuesday chanted slogans of 'Vande Mataram' and waived the tricolour on their return at the Delhi airport. They were welcomed by Union Power Minister RK Singh at the airport. Pictures show the minister interacting with the evacuees and giving them flowers.

356.title: IPL important but you can't cherry pick when to play for Aus: Hayden
356.article_body: Reacting to players like Pat Cummins opting out of the white-ball leg of Australia's tour of Pakistan, Matthew Hayden termed the IPL as important but said players can't "cherry pick" when to play for Australia. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26. "Cricket Australia is being led around by...players. You shouldn't be paid for work you don't do," added Hayden.

357.title: Egyptian King Tut's dagger was made of material from outer space: Experts
357.article_body: A dagger buried with Egypt's teenage King Tutankhamun was made with materials that may have come from outer space, experts have said. The dagger that was first found in 1925 was crafted from iron that may have been brought to Earth by a meteorite, said a recent study published in Meteoritics and Planetary Science journal.

358.title: Manmohan Desai would drive past house, wait for her 'darshan': Nanda's brother
358.article_body: Late actress Nanda's brother Jayprakash Winayak said that late filmmaker Manmohan Desai used to "drive past [her] bungalow hoping to catch a glimpse" of the actress. "He'd even park his car outside waiting for her 'darshan'...There was...Holy Cross opposite Didi's bungalow in Bandra...Manji made it a point to shoot there for films, hoping to get sight of her," he added.

359.title: At least 10 killed in latest rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv: Official
359.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured in rocket strikes by Russian forces on Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv on Tuesday, Ukraine's Interior Ministry adviser Anton Herashchenko said. "The rubble is being cleared and there will be even more victims and wounded," he added. Earlier, an Indian student from Karnataka was killed in shelling in Kharkiv.

360.title: Going to be a big challenge to pick between Shreyas, Suryakumar: Rohit
360.article_body: Talking about picking between Shreyas Iyer and Suryakumar Yadav, Rohit Sharma termed it as a "big" challenge. Shreyas was the top run-getter in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. Suryakumar was India's highest run-scorer in the T20I series against West Indies with 107 runs at a strike rate of 194.54.

361.title: Parents' consent not mandatory for offline exams for Classes 10, 12 in Delhi
361.article_body: The Delhi government on Monday notified that the consent of parents for attending offline classes and giving offline exams is not mandatory for students of Classes 10 and 12. It added schools may deploy transportation facilities for students while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. The hybrid mode for studies for Classes up to 9 and Class 11 will continue till March 31.

362.title: Prabhas and Saif-starrer 'Adipurush' to release on Jan 12, 2023
362.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Prabhas announced the new release date of his film 'Adipurush'. The film, which was slated to release on August 11, will now release on January 12, 2023. Earlier, actor Aamir Khan had thanked the makers of 'Adipurush' for postponing their release date as his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will be releasing on August 11.

363.title: We can't stand back anymore: Benedict on Russia-Ukraine conflict
363.article_body: After being honoured at the Hollywood Walk of Fame, actor Benedict Cumberbatch expressed his support for the people of Ukraine, after Russia invaded the country. Benedict added he also supports the people in Russia who are opposing "kleptocracy and the idiocy of their rulers"."We can't stand back anymore...We need to act, and there are things you can do," he stated.

364.title: SP has hit two centuries in 5 phases of UP elections: Akhilesh
364.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said his party has already hit two centuries in the first five phases of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. "Our announcement to give 300 units free electricity has left the BJP clueless," Akhilesh said at a rally. "People...are fed up with BJP's lies," he added.

365.title: It will be unique if Bumrah becomes Team India captain: Irfan Pathan
365.article_body: Irfan Pathan said it will be "unique" if Jasprit Bumrah becomes Team India captain in the future, as not too many Indian bowlers have been seen in the role of a captain. "Bumrah's journey has been outstanding. He has become India's number one bowler because he plays in all the formats and bowls at difficult stages," added Irfan.

366.title: Record 21 lakh diyas to be lit up in MP's Ujjain on Mahashivratri
366.article_body: Around 21 lakh diyas will be lit up in MP's Ujjain, including 13 lakh diyas on the banks of Kshipra river, as part of Mahashivratri celebrations on Tuesday. "As many as 14,000 volunteers are participating," Ujjain Municipal Commissioner said. With this, the state government is trying to set a record of lighting the highest number of diyas, he added.

367.title: SIT report on border violence in Mon district ready: Nagaland minister
367.article_body: Nagaland minister V Kashiho Sangtam said the Special Investigation Team (SIT) has completed the investigation and is ready with its report on the border violence that took place in Mon district last year. However, it is yet to receive the forensic laboratory report, Sangtam told ANI. As many as 14 civilians were killed in the violence last year.

368.title: Thoughts go out to all suffering from needless war: Louis on cancelling show
368.article_body: Amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine crisis, singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson cancelled his tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv. "I have to sadly announce that my tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv are cancelled until further notice," he wrote, adding, "Safety of my fans is priority, my thoughts go out to the people of Ukraine and all those suffering from this needless war."

369.title: Prospects for diplomatic resolution to Ukraine crisis slim: UK
369.article_body: Britain's Deputy PM Dominic Raab on Tuesday said the prospects of a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis are "slim" at the moment. However, "we must always make sure that we keep the door to a diplomatic resolution open without, I think, instilling too many hopes in it", he added. Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

370.title: It is stupid to think about the possibility of being at war: Conte
370.article_body: Reacting to Vladimir Putin's declaration of war against Ukraine, Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said even "thinking" about the possibility of being at "war" is stupid. "We are in 2022 and to talk about the possibility of being at war is incredible. We need peace, not people dying. The war...is not an answer to anything," stated the former Chelsea manager.

371.title: A tremendous thinker of the game: Labuschagne on Ashwin
371.article_body: Calling Ravichandran Ashwin a "tremendous thinker of the game", Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said not all bowlers are like the India off-spinner. "He [Ashwin] is always thinking about how he can get you out. About what you are doing. And so what he's doing to counter that?" he added. The 35-year-old dismissed Labuschagne twice in Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2020-21 in Australia.

372.title: Space technology important tool for a nation: ISRO Chairman
372.article_body: ISRO Chairman, Dr S Somanath, said space technology is an important tool that a nation needs for good command on the scientific front. "Space technology and rocket science have enabled human beings to send instruments into space lasting for several years," Somanath said. He was speaking at the National Science Day celebrations organised by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Bengaluru.

373.title: Heat waves in Indo-Gangetic plains likely to be lower than normal: IMD
373.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted that the number of heat waves in the Indo-Gangetic plains is likely to be lower than normal during March to May period. As per IMD, a "heat wave" is declared for the plains when the maximum temperature is more than 40°C. Gujarat, Sindh, Punjab, Bihar, Bengal and Assam region come under the Indo-Gangetic plains.

374.title: It's incredibly odd walking in fashion shows amid Ukraine crisis: Bella Hadid
374.article_body: Model Bella Hadid came out in support of her colleague Mica Argañaraz, who vowed to donate part of her fashion week earnings to Ukrainian organisations. Sharing her post, Bella wrote, "It's incredibly odd to be walking in fashion shows...especially during a time like this. I compel...people of our industry to...have open conversations about the hell that's happening next door."

375.title: I thought I was going to be a comedy skit blogger: Jamie Dornan
375.article_body: Actor Jamie Dornan, who played the male lead role of 'Christian Grey' in the 'Fifty Shades' film franchise, said he thought he would be a comedy skit blogger at one point. "Then I did [TV series] 'The Fall' where I play a serial killer. I used to always want to do comedy and then I just didn't," added Dornan.

376.title: 36 Kerala students stranded in Ukraine evacuated, says state govt
376.article_body: As many as 36 students hailing from Kerala, arrived from Ukraine on Monday evening, the state government said. "Kerala students update: Among 36 students arrived from Ukraine to Delhi yesterday (Monday) evening, 25 left for Kochi...11 left for Trivandrum," the Kerala government tweeted on Tuesday. These students were brought back under 'Operation Ganga'.

377.title: Sea-level rise damage in Mumbai could be $162 bn/yr by 2050: IPCC
377.article_body: The IPCC's latest report has warned that damage from sea-level rise in Mumbai alone could be up to $162 billion a year by 2050. Around 35 million people in India could face annual coastal flooding. It added that heat and humidity will globally create conditions beyond human tolerance if emissions are not rapidly eliminated, and India will experience those conditions.

378.title: Jaishankar briefs Prez Ram Nath Kovind on evacuations from Ukraine
378.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday said that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday briefed President Ram Nath Kovind about the ongoing evacuation of Indian nationals from Ukraine which is under attack from Russia. "Later the President called PM Narendra Modi and lauded the government's efforts," it added. The Centre launched 'Operation Ganga' to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

379.title: Key maker allegedly steals jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from Gurugram house
379.article_body: A key maker allegedly stole jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from the house of a retired central government employee in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The incident reportedly occurred when the victim had called the key maker to get an almirah lock repaired at his house. Meanwhile, police have started an investigation into the matter and trying to arrest the accused.

380.title: He was so proud of it: 'Pavitra Rishta' director on Sushant's 'Sonchiriya'
380.article_body: 'Pavitra Rishta' director Kushal Zaveri took to Instagram to share a post about Sushant Singh Rajput starrer 'Sonchiriya' completing three years. "3rd anniversary of #sonchiriya...He was so proud of this film...Please watch it if you haven't," Kushal wrote. Fans took to comment section to show love for film. "Loved this film," one user wrote. "Forever in my heart," wrote another.

381.title: 5 booked for clicking pictures inside polling booth in UP
381.article_body: UP police registered an FIR against five persons for taking pictures and videos inside a polling booth in Sultanpur. The police identified the accused after they posted videos of them casting votes on social media. According to Sultanpur SP Vipin Mishra, they secretly carried their phones inside the booth, which is against the rules.

382.title: 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh seized in Bengaluru, two arrested
382.article_body: The police have arrested two drug peddlers and recovered over 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh from their possession in Bengaluru. The accused have been identified as Prakash (29) and Sundarapandi (25), both residents of Hosur in Tamil Nadu. The accused had purchased the contraband from Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, and were planning to sell it in Bengaluru.

383.title: BMRCL seeks transfer of land ownership to build Kempapura station
383.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation (BMRCL) has sought the transfer of ownership of land falling under the Nagawara lake from the state government. The land will be used to build the airport line's Kempapura cross station. "Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority has issued an NOC to BMRCL to use the land," said BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez.

384.title: Man threatens wife with her obscene pictures in Tamil Nadu, arrested
384.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested in Tamil Nadu after he threatened his 27-year-old wife with her obscene pictures. He also demanded a new house as dowry. The couple had got married in October 2020. The man had reportedly told the woman that she had pimples on her face and he does not wish to spend his life with her.

385.title: Man killed by brother and nephew for selling bull in Nagpur
385.article_body: A 32-year-old man was allegedly killed by his elder brother and nephew for selling a bull without informing them in Bhagebori village of Maharashtra's Nagpur district. The two accused, Hansraj Dekate, 58, and his son Pranay, 24, attacked the victim with a rod and then smashed his head with a stone, police said. They were arrested under charges of murder.

386.title: Minister Hardeep Puri en route to Budapest to aid evacuation of Indians
386.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri is en route to Budapest in Hungary on an Indigo flight to aid the evacuation of Indian citizens stranded in war-hit Ukraine. "All set to bring back our young students back home safely," Puri tweeted. "En route to Budapest with a refuelling stop in Istanbul with the ever efficient 6E boys and girls," he added.

387.title: Court officer stabs judicial magistrate over repeated transfers in TN
387.article_body: An office assistant of court in Tamil Nadu's Salem, Prakash, allegedly stabbed Judicial Magistrate IV M Ponpandi on Tuesday after an argument over his repeated transfers. "Around 10:30 am, Prakash allegedly took out a pen-like sharp object he was hiding...and attacked the judicial magistrate," police said. Ponpandi suffered injuries on the chest and shoulder. Prakash has been arrested.

388.title: I consider actor Raza Murad as my lucky mascot: Sanjay Leela Bhansali
388.article_body: Director Sanjay Leela Bhansali termed actor Raza Murad as his "lucky mascot", adding that Murad had to be a part of his film and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' at any cost. "He has been in my last three films and they were...successes. There was no full-fledged role...this time, so I...asked him to be part of a party sequence," stated Bhansali.

389.title: Europe's joint Mars mission with Russia postponed due to war: ESA
389.article_body: The ExoMars 2022 rover, a joint mission between the European and Russian space agency that was expected to launch this year is now "very unlikely" to take place due to sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine. "We are fully implementing sanctions imposed on Russia by our Member States," the European Space Agency said in a statement.

390.title: Today LPG, tomorrow petrol & diesel: Rahul Gandhi criticises LPG price hike
390.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the hike in the price of LPG cylinders. "By increasing the prices of LPG, PM Modi-led government made it clear that it is not concerned about the suffering of common people. Today LPG, tomorrow petrol and diesel," Gandhi tweeted. The price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders has increased by ₹105 in Delhi.

391.title: 25-yr-old woman found hanging at marital home in UP, probe underway
391.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was found hanging at her marital home in the Banda district of Uttar Pradesh, reports said. According to reports, the husband of the deceased, Amit Gupta, found the house locked from inside on Monday and informed the police when it was not opened despite repeated knocks. Police said a case of suicide has been registered.

392.title: Gurugram likely to receive light rainfall on Thursday: IMD
392.article_body: Gurugram is likely to receive light rain and thundershowers on Thursday, because of the impact of a western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. According to IMD's forecast, Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to drop by one or two degrees, while the minimum temperature is likely to rise by at least three degrees.

393.title: Bobby reacts to viral memes featuring him, says 'Keep hilarious stuff coming'
393.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol reacted to viral memes featuring him in a new video, as part of his film Love Hostel's promotions. The video begins with a still of Bobby, in which he seems to be using an airpod. Reacting to it, Bobby said, "I've always been ahead of time." Alongside the video, Bobby wrote, "Keep such hilarious stuff coming."

394.title: BSP candidates decided in Amit Shah's room: SBSP's Rajbhar
394.article_body: Alleging BSP supremo Mayawati of helping BJP win in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar said, the BSP candidates are being finalised in Amit Shah's room. Earlier, Amit Shah had said that BSP is still relevant and will get Jatav and Muslim votes. The SBSP is contesting in 18 Assembly seats in alliance with the SP.

395.title: Equation we had with journalists was better than what boys have today: Shastri
395.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the equation of cricketers with journalists has changed since the time he used to play. "The equation we had with the journalists was far far better than the equation you see with the boys today," he stated. Recently, wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha received threatening WhatsApp messages from a journalist.

396.title: Amazon India elevates Amit Agarwal to head emerging markets
396.article_body: Amazon India's country head Amit Agarwal has been appointed as the Senior Vice President India and Emerging Markets at Amazon. Manish Tiwary, vice-president of the consumer business, will be the country manager for consumer business in India. Tiwary will also be responsible for Amazon Business, its business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce platform which sells goods to small and medium enterprises.

397.title: Police arrest 2 gangsters after cross-firing in Outer Delhi's Alipur
397.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two gangsters, aged 31 and 22, after 22 rounds of bullets were fired by both parties in Outer Delhi's Alipur. A woman sub-inspector received two bullets on her bullet-proof jacket, police said. "The gangsters were planning to kill a Delhi police official and Tillu Tajpuria, a rival gangster who is in jail," police added.

398.title: Dancer drugged, raped by contractor and his 10 aides in UP
398.article_body: A professional dancer in Uttar Pradesh's Bithoor was allegedly drugged and gang-raped by a contractor and his ten aides. The woman claimed the accused invited her to perform at a farmhouse and offered her cold drink laced with sedatives. After drinking it she became unconscious and was raped by him and his aides who also filmed the act, she alleged.

399.title: BBMP bans sale of meat across Bengaluru on Maha Shivaratri
399.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has ordered a complete ban on the sale of meat across Bengaluru on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. The BBMP's animal advisory division had issued a circular to this effect on February 22. The circular also extends to the ban of animal slaughter in the city.

400.title: Man's partially burnt body found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area
400.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 29-year-old man was found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area on Monday, police said. The deceased, identified as Abdul Salam Munawar Ali Sayyed, succumbed to a head injury and was burnt by the accused likely to destroy evidence, the post-mortem report suggested. The body was first spotted by a resident, who then informed the police.

401.title: Domestic helps drug house owner's daughter in Gurugram, steal jewellery
401.article_body: Three house helps, including two maids and a former cook, allegedly drugged the house owner's daughter and stole jewellery and other valuables worth ₹15 lakh in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The girl's parents had reportedly gone to Mumbai when the incident occurred. Police said the crime seems to be well planned, adding that they're trying to trace the accused.

402.title: Author Stephen King shares rare pic in support of Ukraine, country responds
402.article_body: American author Stephen King shared a photo of himself wearing a t-shirt that said 'I stand with Ukraine' and wrote, "I don't usually post pictures of myself, but today is an exception." Meanwhile, Ukraine responded, "We'll prevail over those langoliers for you, sir." King had also tweeted, "For the first time in a long and infamous career, Putin looks stupid."

403.title: K'taka CM speaks with father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
403.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Tuesday spoke with the father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student who was killed in shelling in Ukraine. Naveen was a resident of the Haveri district. "All efforts will be made to bring back Naveen's body to India," his office said, adding that this matter is being negotiated with foreign ministry officials.
